title: Geometry Dash: How to Get Secret Coins + Easiest & Hardest Coins

steps.title: Easiest Secret Coin: the Coming Soon page.
steps.content: Easiest Secret Coin: the Coming Soon page. If you scroll through the list of official Geometry Dash levels three times, you will find a Secret Coin on the "Coming Soon" page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Hardest Secret Coin: level Coins.
steps.content: Hardest Secret Coin: level Coins. While "hardest" is subjective, many users have called out some levels as having notoriously difficult secret coins (such as Theory of Everything, Theory of Everything 2, Polargeist, Stereo Madness, and Jumper, to name a few). In total, there are 66 Secret Coins obtained from levels (3 per level), and though some of these Coins aren't hard to get, some are very difficult.

steps.title: Completing map packs.
steps.content: Completing map packs. You can get 83 Secret Coins from completing map packs. There's 1 Secret Coin per pack, though Demon difficulty packs will give 2 Coins.

steps.title: Completing Tower tasks.
steps.content: Completing Tower tasks. There are 12 Secret Coins awarded for completing specific tasks within the Tower. The Tower can be found on the second to last page of the menu slider. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Secret codes.
steps.content: Secret codes. There are two secret codes that will give you Secret Coins. These codes are listed below: Enter sparky into the regular Vault to get one Secret Coin. Enter glubfub into the Vault of Secrets for another Secret Coin. The Vault of Secrets is unlocked via the creator menu for 50 Diamonds . [3] X Research source

steps.title: User Coins are the same as Secret Coins, but only for user levels.
steps.content: User Coins are the same as Secret Coins, but only for user levels. Official Geometry Dash levels have three Secret Coins in them, whereas user-created levels can have up to three User Coins. [4] X Research source There are currently 164 Secret Coins in Geometry Dash. Secret Coins are gold with a star on them. There is no count of how many user-created levels have User Coins. In an unverified level, User Coins are bronze with a "C" on them, and once a level is verified those Coins turn silver.
